ETYMOLOGY: From Old English dor (plural: doru), from Proto-Germanic *durz, from Proto-Indo-European *dʰwer- 'door, gate'. Cognate with German Tür, Dutch deur, Old Norse dyrr, Latin foris.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A movable barrier, typically hinged, sliding, or revolving, used for opening and closing an entrance to a building, room, or vehicle, or in the wall of a cupboard.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于开启和关闭建筑物、房间、车辆入口或橱柜壁的、通常可活动的屏障（如门板）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Please close the door when you leave the room.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An opportunity or means of access to something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 获得某物的机会或途径。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: This scholarship opened many doors for her future career.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这项奖学金为她未来的职业生涯打开了许多大门。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to refer to a house, apartment, or establishment.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My neighbors live next door and are very friendly.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我的邻居住隔壁，他们非常友好。
